cluster_relations.rel_desc: Pygmalion is the sculptor who creates the statue Galatea.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: StoryContext: myth of Pygmalion and Galatea

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Pygmalion falls in love with his statue, Galatea.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: before the statue comes to life
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: NarrativeStage: initial state of the myth

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject brings the object into existence as a created work or artifact.
args.justification: The relation instance describes Pygmalion as the sculptor who brings the statue Galatea into existence; this is a straightforward creator–creation predicate.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject has romantic or strong affectionate feelings toward the object.
args.justification: The instance describes Pygmalion falling in love with Galatea, which is a clear emotional/affective predicate from subject to object.
The relation captures a sculptor–statue creation event, which fits a more specific class of artistic or creative production relations.
The predicate models an affective state (love) from one character toward another, fitting an emotional/affective relation class.
Creation here involves an intentional agent (the sculptor) producing an artifact, which best aligns with an agency/actor-driven category.
Love is an interpersonal, affective tie between entities and fits a broad group of social/relational associations.
